segment.source: Windows Setup Log Files and Event Logs
segment.target: Windows Setup Log Files and Event Logs

segment.source: Windows Setup Log Files and Event Logs
segment.target: Windows Setup Log Files and Event Logs

segment.source: Windows Setup Log Files and Event Logs
segment.target: Windows Setup Log Files and Event Logs

segment.source: Windows® Setup creates log files for all actions that occur during installation.
segment.target: Windows® Setup creates log files for all actions that occur during installation.

segment.source: If you are experiencing problems installing Windows, consult the log files to troubleshoot the installation.
segment.target: If you are experiencing problems installing Windows, consult the log files to troubleshoot the installation.

segment.source: Windows Setup log files are available in the following directories:
segment.target: Windows Setup log files are available in the following directories:

segment.source: Log file location
segment.target: Log file location

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: $windows.~bt\Sources\Panther
segment.target: $windows.~bt\Sources\Panther

segment.source: Log location before Setup can access the drive.
segment.target: Log location before Setup can access the drive.

segment.source: $windows.~bt\Sources\Rollback
segment.target: $windows.~bt\Sources\Rollback

segment.source: Log location when Setup rolls back in the event of a fatal error.
segment.target: Log location when Setup rolls back in the event of a fatal error.

segment.source: %WINDIR%\Panther
segment.target: %WINDIR%\Panther

segment.source: Log location of Setup actions after disk configuration.
segment.target: Log location of Setup actions after disk configuration.

segment.source: %WINDIR%\Inf\Setupapi*.log
segment.target: %WINDIR%\Inf\Setupapi*.log

segment.source: Used to log Plug and Play device installations.
segment.target: Used to log Plug and Play device installations.

segment.source: %WINDIR%\Memory.dmp
segment.target: %WINDIR%\Memory.dmp

segment.source: Location of memory dump from bug checks.
segment.target: Location of memory dump from bug checks.

segment.source: %WINDIR%\Minidump.dmp
segment.target: %WINDIR%\Minidump.dmp

segment.source: Location of log minidumps from bug checks.
segment.target: Location of log minidumps from bug checks.

segment.source: %WINDIR%\System32\Sysprep\Panther
segment.target: %WINDIR%\System32\Sysprep\Panther

segment.source: Location of Sysprep logs.
segment.target: Location of Sysprep logs.

segment.source: Windows Setup Event Logs
segment.target: Windows Setup Event Logs

segment.source: Windows Setup includes the ability to review the Windows Setup performance events in the Windows Event Log viewer.
segment.target: Windows Setup includes the ability to review the Windows Setup performance events in the Windows Event Log viewer.

segment.source: This enables you to more easily review the actions that occurred during Windows Setup and to review the performance statistics for different parts of Windows Setup.
segment.target: This enables you to more easily review the actions that occurred during Windows Setup and to review the performance statistics for different parts of Windows Setup.

segment.source: You can filter the log so as to view only relevant items that you are interested in.
segment.target: You can filter the log so as to view only relevant items that you are interested in.

segment.source: The Windows Setup performance events are saved into a log file that is named Setup.etl, which is available in the %WINDIR%Panther directory of all installations.
segment.target: The Windows Setup performance events are saved into a log file that is named Setup.etl, which is available in the %WINDIR%Panther directory of all installations.

segment.source: To view the logs, you must use the Event Viewer included with the Windows media that corresponds to the version of the customized image that you are building.
segment.target: To view the logs, you must use the Event Viewer included with the Windows media that corresponds to the version of the customized image that you are building.

segment.source: To view the logs on a computer that does not include the corresponding kit, you must run a script from the root of the media that installs the Event Trace for Windows (ETW) provider.
segment.target: To view the logs on a computer that does not include the corresponding kit, you must run a script from the root of the media that installs the Event Trace for Windows (ETW) provider.

segment.source: From the command line, type:
segment.target: From the command line, type:

segment.source: where D is the drive letter of the Windows DVD media.
segment.target: where D is the drive letter of the Windows DVD media.

segment.source: To view the Windows Setup event logs
segment.target: To view the Windows Setup event logs

segment.source: Start the Event Viewer, expand the Windows Logs node, and then click System.
segment.target: Start the Event Viewer, expand the Windows Logs node, and then click System.

segment.source: In the Actions pane, click Open Saved Log and then locate the Setup.etl file.
segment.target: In the Actions pane, click Open Saved Log and then locate the Setup.etl file.

segment.source: By default, this file is available in the %WINDIR%Panther directory.
segment.target: By default, this file is available in the %WINDIR%Panther directory.

segment.source: The log file contents appear in the Event Viewer.
segment.target: The log file contents appear in the Event Viewer.

segment.source: To Export the log to a file
segment.target: To Export the log to a file

segment.source: From the command line, use the Wevtutil or Tracerpt commands to save the log to an .xml or text file.
segment.target: From the command line, use the Wevtutil or Tracerpt commands to save the log to an .xml or text file.

segment.source: For information about how to use these tools, see the command-line Help.
segment.target: For information about how to use these tools, see the command-line Help.

segment.source: The following commands show examples of how to use the tools:
segment.target: The following commands show examples of how to use the tools:

segment.source: -or-
segment.target: -or-
